Detailed Description

Simple behavior that will keep the vehicle in a predefined range to its two closes neighbours.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum BHV_StayInRange::VehicleState [private]
 

The Current state of the vehicle.

The vehicle can be in one of following states:

CHILLIN -- stopped
CREEPING -- moving towards target
GUNNIN -- moving away from target
The different states are used for evaluating if the vehicle has moved to the desired interval location.

domain an Interval Programming (IvP) domain.

Member Function Documentation

bool BHV_StayInRange::amInearestTarget (   )  [protected]
 

Checks if any of the neighbours are closer to the target.

Returns:
true if no one else is closer, false otherwise.

void BHV_StayInRange::findNeighbours (  double  rangeRadious  )  [protected]
 

Finds the all neighbours in the given range.

All vehicle names registered in the moos environment are inspected and neighbours are selected based on their name. For instance if all the kayaks are named kayak1, kayak2, ... kayakn, the neighbours to kayak1 will be those with name kayakn and range < rangeRadious.

Parameters:
rangeRadious vehicle that have a range < rangeRadious will be looked at.
TBD now only looking at vehicle with same name, might want to change that. String comparison is also done by the first 3 chars...

double BHV_StayInRange::getPriority (   )  [protected]
 

Calculets the priority for the behavior depending on the distance to the target.

If targetRange is grater then targetRangeMax then the priority is set to the priority weight paramater -- priority_wt -- which is in the range [0,100]. The priority then drops linearly when targetRange is in [targetRangeMin,targetRangeMax] and is 0 for targetRange < targetRangeMin.

Returns:
the priority in the range of [0,priority_wt]

bool BHV_StayInRange::isAtHalfwayMark (   )  [protected]
 

Checks if if we have reached the halfway mark for the interval [targetRangeMin targetRangeMax].

Returns:
true if we have passed the halfway mark, false otherwise.

bool BHV_StayInRange::localizeTarget (   )  [protected]
 

Used when useTargetRanging is set true.

Utilizes the MOOSDB variable PING_TIME set by pACom to compute the distance and 3D location of the target. At least four sources are needed for this to work.

Based on localization code from Carrick Detweiler. If something is not working -- blame him.

This method will set the value of targetRange and the coordinates variables of the target object.

Returns:
false if the localization failed, true otherwise.

IvPFunction * BHV_StayInRange::produceOF (   ) 
 

Creates an objective function.

Note:
All state updates are done here.

bool BHV_StayInRange::sendTargetData (   )  [protected]
 

Sends the position coordinates; targetX, targetY and targetZ to the target using pACom.

Returns:
true if the send was successfull, false otherwise.

bool BHV_StayInRange::setParam (  string  param,
string  val
) 
 

Reads parameters from .bhv file.

Is called repeatedly until all parameters are read within the block.

Parameters:
param the current parameter parsed the .bhv file.
val the string value of that parameter.
Returns:
true if the parameter was found and successfully set, false otherwise.

Information about close by neighbours is stored here with the closest one firts.

The Current state of the vehicle.

The vehicle can be in one of following states:

CHILLIN -- stopped
CREEPING -- moving towards target
GUNNIN -- moving away from target
The different states are used for evaluating if the vehicle has moved to the desired interval location.
